|speed = |elevation = |map = |map_state = open }} '"Nottingham" Express Transit'
('NET') is a light-rail tramway in England. The first line opened to the public
on 9 March 2004, having cost Â£200 million (equivalent to Â£|r=-4}}}} at prices)
to construct. The scheme took 16 years from conception to implementation. It is
operated by Tramlink Nottingham, a consortium of Meridiam Infrastructure, OFI
InfraVia, Alstom Transport, Keolis, VINCI Investments and Wellglade Group. It was operated by Arrow Light Rail from 9 March 2004 until 16 December 2011.
categories: Electric railways in the United Kingdom
